project.teaser: In order to prevent and reverse inequalities and promote girls and womens inclusion, representation and empowerment, it is necessary to better understand the root causes of gendered power hierarchies and gender gaps across political, social, economic and cultural...
project.objective:
In order to prevent and reverse inequalities and promote girls and womens inclusion, representation and empowerment, it is necessary to better understand the root causes of gendered power hierarchies and gender gaps across political, social, economic and cultural spheres.
RE-WIRINGs overall objective is to contribute to practical, sustainable and structural institutional change in these spheres, through evidence-based understanding of cumulative effects of gender stereotyping and multiple forms of discrimination and disadvantages.
The project therefore involves extensive research in six countries, including Belgium, the Netherlands, Spain, South Africa, Poland and the UK and collaboration with a variety of stakeholders. The project team will carry out a survey and interventions, in addition to qualitative data collection, media discourse analysis and legal policy analysis. RE-WIRING incorporates innovative responses to the challenge to properly identify how the interrelations of power and barriers shape gender (in)equality and exclusion within the different spheres and how these can be effectively changed.
It does so, first, by developing an approach that combines insights from the institutional, experiential and symbolic levels of gender (in)equality in the fields of decision-making, law and policies, work, education and media. This will provide the basis for a much needed multidisciplinary Transformative Equality Approach. This approach will also add to the state-of -the-art by taking intersectionality, culture and crises into account as relevant contextual factors for making such an approach work. Second, the analysis combines various research techniques geared towards co-creating practical solutions, innovative tools and policy responses for the effective mainstreaming of transformative equality in public and private institutions. The project thus aims to re-wire institutions so as to dismantle the structural root causes of gendered power hierarchies
project.title: Realising Girls’ and Women's Inclusion, Representation and Empowerment
project.keywords: Media Studies, Inclusion, Inequality, Intersectionality, Sociology, Anti-Discrimination, Law, Empowerment

article.title: Dismantling root causes of gender discrimination

category.title: Project description

article.title: Forging a path to gender equality in the workplace
Tackling inequality through inclusive education and social support
Overcoming the constraints that shape women’s career choices
How susceptible is household work to automation?
The reality behind a stalled gender equality revolution
How structural inequalities within society hold women back

article.teaser: RE-WIRING researchers tackle women’s representation in the workplace and present their findings to the Parliament of the United Kingdom.

result.title: Country-level reports and infographic on gendered nature of law- and policymaking approach
result.description: This Deliverable will be a compilation of case studies of the countries under study in Task T2.1 concerning the gendered nature of law- and policymaking processes and crisis response towards gender-based violence.

result.title: Development of a policy evaluation checklist to identify and tackle gendered law- and policymaking processes
result.description: This policy evaluation checklist will form the basis for comparatively identifying and tackling gendered law- and policymaking processes.

result.title: The ethics of doing research on gendered power hierarchies
result.description: This working paper will review scientific debates on the ethics of doing research on gendered power hierarchies.

result.title: Working Paper on effective transformative equality processes towards leadership positions
result.description: This working paper will provide recommendations for facilitating transformative equality approaches in key areas of decision-making, such as in government, parliaments, crisis-response teams and on boards of large companies.

result.title: Working paper: A review of concepts of gendered power hierarchies and taxonomy
result.description: This working paper reviews scientific debates about gendered power hierarchies in the contemporary context and proposes an operational concept for the purpose of the RE-WIRING project. The taxonomy will provide a matrix of gendered power hierarchies and relate them to indicators.

result.title: Case study template for assessing the gendered impacts of various crises
result.description: Building on Task T6.1, the case study template will provide a shared interdisciplinary conceptual and theoretical framework for assessing the gendered impacts of various crises.

result.title: Working Paper: Root causes of gendered law- and policymaking processes and their effective tackling
result.description: Based on D2.2, this Deliverable provides a comparative analysis of the national laws and policies addressing the gendered nature of law- and policymaking processes.

result.title: Working paper: RE-WIRING’s Transformative Equality Approach and research methodology template
result.description: This working paper develops a meta-framework guiding the project as a whole and the research methodology.

result.title: Review paper: Tools to de-bias gendered educational choices
result.description: This review paper will compare tools that aim at de-biasing gendered educational choice, considering different national contexts, school types, age groups.

result.title: Review paper: Institutional, experiential and symbolic agents involved in the development of gendered norms and choices in educational choices
result.description: Based on Task T3.1, this review paper will identify the institutional, experiential and symbolic agents that play a central role in the development of gendered norms and choices in educational choices, particularly related to future selves.

result.title: Toolkit on Gender Gap in Representation at Work
result.description: Based on the systemic literature review, carried out as part of Task T4.1, this toolkit will allow stakeholders, as well as a wider audience, to identify practices that have successfully addressed the Gender Gap in representation in the finance, sustainability and health sectors.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - RE-WIRING (Realising Girls’ and Women's Inclusion, Representation and Empowerment)
result.teaser: To prevent and reverse inequalities and promote girls’ and women’s inclusion, representation and empowerment, the root causes of gendered power hierarchies and gender gaps across political, social, economic and cultural spheres have to be identified. RE-WIRING’s aim is...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
